DOC.brief_title: A Multicenter Access Distribution Protocol Unlicensed Cryopreserved Cord Blood Units ( CBUs )
DOC.detailed_description: Principal Investigators : The principal investigator ( PIs ) transplant physician participate U.S. transplant center . Study Design : This study access distribution protocol unlicensed cryopreserved cord blood unit ( CBUs ) pediatric adult patient hematologic malignancy indication . Primary Objective : The primary objective study examine incidence neutrophil recovery â‰¥500/mm3 cord blood transplantation multi-institution set use CBUs Food Drug Administration ( FDA ) license . Secondary Objectives : In patient receive non-licensed CBU : - Assess incidence transmission infection - Assess incidence serious infusion reaction - Determine 1 year overall survival cord blood transplantation - Assess cumulative incidence acute graft vs. host disease ( GVHD ) grade II IV grade III IV - Assess cumulative incidence chronic GVHD - Determine platelet engraftment > 20,000 mcL > 50,000 mcL
